ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Your level of German will improve significantly, as you go through the grammar in-depth so intensively that you become familiar with both common and very niche structures and phrases. It is academically focused though, so dont expect to be ready to understand a lot of everyday speech.
I feel like Im actually able to translate basic texts now without even needing a dictionary. My German grammar and vocabulary have also greatly improved.
I significantly increased my German reading ability.
I can now read German articles with a dictionary to a practical level of understanding.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is as fun as a grammar-based course can really be. Professor Sebastian is great and she makes the class feel more like a group effort than anything. Sometimes the in pair work could be daunting, however. Also this course does not meet any distributional requirements so take that into consideration when you take it.

It was so well organized! Cecilia did a great job. I accomplished every goal I had set for this course.
The only negative is that it was listed as a course without prior German experience required. I had prior German experience and thought the pace was lightning fast! Still manageable. But, it was definitely quicker than the description made it out to be.

The instructor was very knowledgeable, the textbook assigned was very effective, and the class was aimed at an appropriate skill level. My only recommendation would be perhaps more translations available from a diversity of sources.

Overall, we got through all the material in the textbook and Cecilia was really engaging and responsive to any questions we had. I felt the pace in the first half of the semester was very intense and sometimes felt a bit rushed overall. But the second half incorporated a lot of reading, and in our own subject areas, which was particularly useful. I had some issues with some of the Canvas quizzes etc., with links not working.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have some prior experience with German, then sure. However, I will warn you that this is NOT a course you should take if you want to learn the German language from scratch. You need at least some prior knowledge of the language and also a lot of confidence in grammar. Dont take this course if you dont at least have an A2 vocab or you will be in a lot of pain.
I definitely would! If your work after graduation involves working with German texts, this course is invaluable!
Yes. It was very effective at achieving the goal of improving of my German reading ability.

For someone looking to learn to read academic German, this course did exactly what I needed it to. However, I had experience of two other modern languages already which helped with grammar acquisition and familiarity, so the pace might be challenging for those without this framework.
